To the chief Musician upon Nehiloth, A Psalm of David. Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my meditation.
Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.
My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD; in the morning will I direct <FI>my prayer<Fi> unto thee, and will look up.
For thou <FI>art<Fi> not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.
The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.<RF>in…: Heb. before thine eyes<Rf>
Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the LORD will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.<RF>bloody…: Heb. man of bloods and deceit<Rf><CM>
But as for me, I will come <FI>into<Fi> thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: <FI>and<Fi> in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.<RF>thy holy…: Heb. the temple of thy holiness<Rf>
Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.<RF>mine…: Heb. those which observe me<Rf>

For <FI>there is<Fi> no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part <FI>is<Fi> very wickedness; their throat <FI>is<Fi> an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.<RF>faithfulness: or, stedfastness<Rf><RF>their mouth: Heb. his mouth, that is, the mouth of any of them<Rf><RF>very…: Heb. wickednesses<Rf>

Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.<RF>Destroy…: or, Make them guilty<Rf><RF>by…: or, from their counsels<Rf>

But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.<RF>defendest…: Heb. coverest over, or, protectest them<Rf>
For thou, LORD, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as <FI>with<Fi> a shield.<RF>compass: Heb. crown<Rf><CM>
